resources.string: Store personal notes, contact info or questions for the speakers
Your notes will be displayed here, after you save them with a click on save. Keep in mind, this storage is not very persistent!
If you were interested in supporting us, ping organizers Roxy or Anna on our slack

As community of volunteers we work with external speakers and tutors.\nOur meetups are possible not only thanks to us but also thanks to the wonderful support, that we receive from Google and companies that are listed below. This is our contribution to making Berlin\'s tech scene diverse and inclusive!

This App was created as learning project that would benefit the community WTM Berlin üíª. 
It is a great place to start an adventure of becoming an open source contributor! Check the issues list in our GitHub Repository, some are labeled with `good first issue`. Support us by adding a pull request üöÄ

Feel free to submit issues, pull requests or to create forks:
Organizers and community members about WTMB

Women Techmakers Berlin is one of the most active chapters of the global Women Techmakers program run by Google. Last year Meetup announced by organising 81 events we the most active tech community in Berlin! At WTM Berlin we are encouraging diversity in tech in Berlin since 2015. Get visibility, networking and resources to make the tech community of Berlin diverse and inclusive! Our activitiesinclude: intense coding study groups, workshops on technical topics or social skills as well as Fireside Chats with inspirational speakers. New and existing members are always welcome to all of the events, and all events are always opened for everyone, regardless of your gender/age/race/experience, etc. We follow the Berlin code of conduct for communities: http://berlincodeofconduct.org
No upcoming events at the moment. Stay tuned!
We are active across social media!
You can find all our events on Meetup.

Slack is one of the main points of our Community - it is a good place to connect with other members, offer positions in #jobs that reach more diverse audience or announce free/discounted diversity tickets.
